name: Ragged Point Inn and Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a mixed bag of reviews this place gets. It always seems that it is the view that keeps this place highly regarded. When we were at the hotel, for on enight, we never saw further than 100 yards so the view was never going to affect our assessment.
reviews.title: Charming, old fashioned yet fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was painless; not fast, not efficient, but friendly and relaxing. Remember you are not in a city centre and should be here to unwind. Unkind and stupid comments elesewhere on this site suggest that things could be quicker, slicker and more up-to-date. I could never agree with such sentiment when staying in such a location. We found things charming, comfortable and extremely satisfactory.
reviews.title: Forget these negative reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was number 23, overlooking the cliff. Was old-fashioned and probaly contained everything original from date of construction in the 1960s? This said, it all worked, all was clean (SPOTLESS!) and perfectly adequate. We loved it!
reviews.title: 2 star hotel, 5 star view, 4 star prices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great night of sleep but would have appreciated some extra pillows to hand.
reviews.title: Most EXCELLENT Service and GORGEOUS Scenery!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ate and the nearby associated restaurant so have reviewed separately.
reviews.title: very nice hotel / excellent view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a trip up the coast, after hearing what an amazing location it is. I tried to get a Cliffside room, but had to settle for a "Lobby Area" room. Too bad!! It was advertised as a "Partial Ocean View" room, but this means, you see a bit of ocean on the right, past the Cliffside building directly in front of you. The room had a lovely little deck with 2 Adirondack chairs, which we enjoyed, but I couldn't help being very disappointed that we hadn't been able to get a cliffside view room, as these have the prime location and amazing views.
reviews.title: Great location, below minimum accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was unbelievably simple and cheap. The bed was OK, but otherwise, the room is furnished with 2 old dressers with drawers (who in the world uses motel drawers, unless you're staying for a week?) and no suitcase valet holder was provided. The TV was fine; no telephone or fridge. No cell phone reception. A tiny coffeemaker; I'd suggest bringing your own coffee and filters. There was a little table and chairs inside, by the sliding glass doors leading to the deck, where we had our dinner. The bath was totally scaled down simple - clean enough, but I have a BIG complaint in that, the shower was old, with a riketty door that hardly closed, and there is NOWHERE to put anything inside the shower!! No soap holder, just the bare shower walls. Come on you guys, how much would it cost to install a simple soap dish?? I hated putting my stuff directly on the shower floor!! yuk! The only toiletry provided were a few bars of the very cheapest soap. Also, the kleenex ran out after we used maybe 2 or 3 of them, and no extra boxes were provided.
reviews.title: Motel 6 with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walls are beyond thin. Just after getting into our room, around 6:00, we were greeted by the sounds of the couple next to us REALLY going at it - it was like they were right in the room with us! Now, we laugh about it, but at the time, we couldn't believe how we could hear their every moan and groan. And they woke us up with it in the morning. Yikes! Consequently, we were careful with our own conversation and noise, after realizing how paper-thin the walls are!
reviews.title: Ungraceful Grace - disappointment with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, this place was OK. We knew upfront that our room would not be fancy. We enjoyed walking around the very beautiful, well-kept grounds, both to watch the sunset that night, and also in the morning. The views of the ocean and cliffs are fantastic. We tried the path down to the beach, but it is VERY steep and unkept, and even though we are seasoned hikers, we decided to turn back after going down a little ways.
reviews.title: Magnificent location and view but nothing more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay here, DO NOT bother booking a Lobby Area room ($159.00 and up) - you'll be disappointed. Spring for the Cliffside Area rooms, ($199.00 and up) which are without a doubt Ragged Point's selling feature, and the only reason to stay in such simple rooms. But - I would also ask to NOT be placed in one of the cliffside rooms with the big trees in front of the view. And another tip - avoid the overpriced restaurant by bringing a few Trader Joe's entrees in a cooler, and your own bottle of wine. Oh and also, bring your own shampoo, lotion and soap, and don't plan on making any calls on your cell phone!
reviews.title: Amazing Views - Over-priced Dump

reviews.text: The view is outstanding and the hotel is quite cute. The people there though think that is enough and don't feel they need to treat the customers nicely. Do stop over yo check out the scenery, and move on to friendlier grounds.
reviews.title: Beutiful scenery, awful service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long drive down the Big Sur from San Francisco, we were pleasantly surprised when we came across the Ragged Point Inn. The grounds were beautiful and the setting of the Inn is absolutely breathtaking. The room we had was large and roomy but a little outdated as far as decor. We also had a fabulous dinner at the restaurant in a very romantic setting as well. I would certainly go back if travelling in the area again and would recommend to friends and family.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location
Beware!! They will give your room away!
reviews.text: CAUTION: They will give your room away!‎

Travelling along the historic PCH, you may be tempted to reserve rooms at the Ragged Point Inn. Yes, the views are breath-taking and teh hotel has a good reputation....BUT BEWARE, THEY WILL GIVE YOUR ROOM AWAY.
reviews.title: Overpriced, thin walls, fee for internet use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last summer, my fiance and I left early in the morning from San Francisco with reservations at the Ragged Point Inn. We travelled through all the main tourist attractions and the day passed very quickly. Cellphone service was intermittent, and we were unable to call ahead for a "late check-in." We trusted that they had our credit card information and would hold the room for our late arrival. At 9pm, we arrived to the manager telling us that they had given our room to someone else, and that they require late check-in calls if you are to arrive after 6pm. You can imagine our dismay. We trusted that we could find another hotel down the road.....BEWARE, YOU WILL NOT FIND A HOTEL WITH VACANCY ALONG THE CALIFORNIA COAST ON A SATURDAY IN THE SUMMER. We searched until 1am and called all the major hotels. We ended up "sleeping" in the rental car (a tiny mustang convertible) at a park in San luis Obispo.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are not up for a rustic getaway, the Ragged Point Inn may not be your cup of tasty inexpensive local chardonnay. I went to the lobby to look at the gift shop, and there were two couples from New York throwing a fit because there are no room phones, no cell phone service, and no hard liquor, only beer and wine. Room quality is Days Inn-ish. We thought the beds were fine, but we like them firm. Food was good, but not cheap; wine was good and WAS cheap; beer from the mini-mart hit the spot after a hike up Salmon Creek. But it's a rustic lodge, 'k? If you want the Ritz Carlton, this ain't it! And I admit, the service was mixed. The restaurant was fine. The ladies who checked us in were great. The guy who checked us out the next morning was not exactly a rocket scientist. Couldn't give directions; no clue on what was up with the fires burning both north and south ... not mean, but not much use.
reviews.title: We loved it, but you might not...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And don't forget the unfriendly and combative service.
reviews.title: Ragged Road House at Charming Bed & Breakfast Prices

reviews.text: Yes, it's true that once you look past the chain link fences and random caution tape that this inn has a spectacular semi-remote setting. But rest assured that once you have booked in to this remote spot, every attempt will be made to squeeze every cent possible from you while nobody will lift a finger to see that you are satisfied.
reviews.title: An awesome view...hard beds!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What is hard to see from the hotel website is that the inn is really a roadside complex with the inn, a restaurant, a ramshackle snack shack, a mini-mart, and a gas station that attracts every roadworn traveler and their myriad of motor bikes and other loud vehicles on their way up the coast. You can expect that every purchase from any of these venues will be of the poorest quality and most outrageous pricing. We were told that the restaurant's expensive steaks were from the organic Hearst ranch, but they were so underseasoned and overcooked who knows what they were. Despite steep rates, breakfast was not included and was equally overpriced. Wireless internet also was extra and expensive. Even the only working phone was a pay phone. And gas was fully a dollar more per gallon than any other price I observed in California.
reviews.title: Amazing grounds, tired furnishings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms seemed clean but were shabby and unpleasant. Thick carpet seemd less than hygenic. The mattress had as varied a topography as the landscape. Walls were so thin we could hear every movement of our neighbors. Windows did not fully close. Privacy was nill. And what should have been one minor misunderstanding with the night staff at the front desk resulted in my getting screamed at and chased out of the office. I exaggerate not. A knock on my door and apology were quck to follow, but too little too late as far as I am concerned.
reviews.title: Superb Location

description: Ragged Point Inn, perched high on a cliff top overlooking the rugged Pacific, is the ideal place to take in the beauty and majesty of California’s Big Sur coast. Relax in one of our 39 spacious and comfortable rooms. Each come with one of the most beautiful views of the Pacific you’ll ever experience - sunrise or sunset. Enjoy fine, fresh cuisine in our award winning gourmet restaurant. Shop in our gift shop, filled with art and collectibles from local artists. Planning a wedding or special event? We have the perfect venue for that special day and can provide you with assistance in every detail. Located between Los Angeles and San Francisco, Ragged Point Inn is one stop on picturesque Highway One that you do not want to miss. We invite you to be our guest.
